perturbation.original_text: 1.1 Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Todos hereby grants the Reseller a non-sublicensable, non-transferable, exclusive right to distribute and sell the Products to Customers in the Territory; provided, however, that Reseller may sub-license or transfer its distribution rights to a subsidiary or affiliate of the Reseller. The Reseller shall have a right of first refusal to include within this Agreement any additional products developed, manufactured, or sold by the Company following the Effective Date that are not currently included in Exhibit A, and upon the exercise of such right, the term “Products” shall be expanded to mean such additional products as well. For purposes of clarity, the parties agree that upon Todos’s development of a blood screening test for colon cancer, such product shall be added to this Agreement and included within the definition of “Products”, subject to the Reseller and Todos agreeing on the commercial terms for such product, including the price.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Todos hereby grants the Reseller a non-sublicensable, non-transferable, exclusive right to distribute and sell the Products to Customers in the Territory; provided, however, that Reseller may sub-license or transfer its distribution rights to a subsidiary or affiliate of the Reseller. The Reseller shall have a right of first refusal to include within this Agreement any additional products developed, manufactured, or sold by the Company following the Effective Date that are not currently included in Exhibit A, and upon the exercise of such right, the term “Products” shall be expanded to mean such additional products as well. For purposes of clarity, the parties agree that upon Todos’s development of a blood screening test for colon cancer, such product *may* be added to this Agreement and included within the definition of “Products”, subject to the Reseller and Todos agreeing on the commercial terms for such product, including the price.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that colon cancer screening test SHALL be added to the Products definition. The modified clause changes this to MAY be added, creating a contradiction and opening the door to disputes on what constitutes 'Products'.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1 The Reseller shall use all commercially reasonable efforts to market, promote, distribute, and sell the Products to Customers in the Territory, and shall, on its own account, provide a trained and competent sales and marketing team for the efficient promotion and sale of the Products. The Reseller shall achieve the commercialization milestones by the dates set forth in the Commercialization Timetable attached hereto as Exhibit C.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 The Reseller shall use commercially reasonable efforts to market, promote, distribute, and sell the Products to Customers in the Territory, and shall, on its own account, provide a sales and marketing team for the promotion and sale of the Products. The Reseller shall achieve the commercialization milestones, detailed but not limited to, the dates set forth in the Commercialization Timetable attached hereto as Exhibit C.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the reseller shall achieve the commercialization milestones. The modified text changes this and add the words 'detailed but not limited to'. This implies the milestones in exhibit c may not be exhaustive which contradicts the definite language in other parts of the agreement, creating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: 5.5 Delivery. Todos shall ship ordered Products to the Reseller within ninety (90) days of Todos’s acceptance of the applicable purchase order DAP Reseller’s warehouse (Incoterms 2010), provided that Reseller’s order for the Products does not deviate from the applicable Forecast by more than ten percent (10%).
perturbation.changed_text: 5.5 Delivery. Todos shall ship ordered Products to the Reseller within a reasonable time, expected to be ninety (90) days of Todos’s acceptance of the applicable purchase order DAP Reseller’s warehouse (Incoterms 2010), provided that Reseller’s order for the Products does not deviate from the applicable Forecast by more than ten percent (10%).
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies a delivery time of ninety (90) days. The modified clause changes this to 'reasonable time, expected to be ninety (90) days', creating ambiguity. What constitutes a 'reasonable time' is open to interpretation and contradicts the specific 90-day timeframe, especially if another part of the agreement hinges on the 90-day deadline.
